Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • sample.Main
        • sample.DatabaseManager

  • public class DatabaseManager
extends Main
    This class contains all the database operation. it has the methods to compare, store data, validate data, delete data and etc
    Since:
    2019-09-21, 2019-09-21
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Romanov Andre, Shafi Mushfique, Stephen Aranda

      • startDatabase

        public void startDatabase(java.lang.String userName,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          java.lang.String role)
        This method is used to start working with database that involves the users username, password, and role.
        Parameters:
        userName - The users unique username for identification.
        password - The users unique password used to be able to log in.
        role - The users role which has an option of being an admin,a client, a custodian, or a desk assistant.

        Returns:
        The list containing the card information
        Throws:

      • verifyPasswordorPin

        public boolean verifyPasswordorPin(java.lang.String userType,
                                   java.lang.String userID,
                                   java.lang.String pinOrPassword,
                                   java.lang.String verifyType)
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Password validation for changing the pin.
        Parameters:
        userType - Type of the user
        userID - Unique ID
        pinOrPassword - Pin or Password depends on users method of changing
        verifyType - Verify type (Pin or Password)
        Returns:
        True if password or pin validate before changing the pin or password
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Exception on sql error.

      • changePinOrPass

        public void changePinOrPass(java.lang.String userType,
                            java.lang.String userId,
                            java.lang.String typeChange,
                            java.lang.String newPinOrPass)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method makes it possible to update the users pin or password by accepting the user type, user Id, the kind of change (Pin or Password), and finally the new pin or password.
        Parameters:
        userType - The type of user that is logged in.
        userId - The Id of the user logged in.
        typeChange - The type of change that is being made (Pin or Password).
        newPinOrPass - The new pin or password that is entered by the user.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Exception on sql error.

      • addByOwner

        public boolean addByOwner(java.lang.String typeUser,
                          java.lang.String email,
                          java.lang.String userId,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          int verifyPin)
        This method is used to create an account as an owner by accepting the required credentials.
        Parameters:
        typeUser - A string that represents the type of user.
        email - A string that represents the email of the user.
        userId - A string that represents the user Id of the user.
        password - A string that represents the password of the user.
        verifyPin - An integer that represents the pin of the user along with its verification.
        Returns:
        A boolean value named 'nameDoesntExist' that is set to false and returns when the admin attemps to enter

      • AddCustomer

        public boolean AddCustomer(java.lang.String fullName,
                           java.lang.String userName,
                           java.lang.String email,
                           java.lang.String phonenumber,
                           java.lang.String password,
                           int verifyPin,
                           java.lang.String address,
                           java.lang.String city,
                           java.lang.String state,
                           int zipcode,
                           java.lang.String country)
        This method makes it possible to add a new customer into the database when a user decides to sign up for our application.
        Parameters:
        fullName - The first and last name of the user.
        userName - The username that the user sets up.
        email - The email of the user.
        phonenumber - The phone number of the user.
        password - The password of the user.
        verifyPin - The pin of the user.
        address - The address of the user.
        city - The city the user resides in.
        state - The state the user resides in.
        zipcode - The zipcode of the county the user resides in.
        country - The country the user resides in.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of whether the username exists already or not is returned, which determines if the account can be created.

      • LogInAccount

        public boolean LogInAccount(java.lang.String email,
                            java.lang.String password,
                            java.lang.String role)
        This method makes it possible for the user to be able to log in using their log in credentials such as their email, password, and their roles (Admin, Guest, Desk Assistant, Custodian).
        Parameters:
        email - This string represents the email of the user.
        password - This string represents the password of the user.
        role - This string represents the role of the user (Admin, Guest, Custodian, Desk Assistant).
        Returns:
        A boolean value named verified is returned, it returns true if the username and password of the user is typed correctly and returns false otherwise.

        public void saveCardInfo(java.lang.String userId,
                         java.lang.String cardType,
                         long cardNumber,
                         int month,
                         int year,
                         int cvv,
                         int zipcode)
        This method makes it possible to save the users card information into the data base by inserting the parameter values into the card saved table.
        Parameters:
        userId - A string that represents the unique user Id of the user.
        cardType - A string that represents the users payment card type.
        cardNumber - A long value that represents the card number of the user.
        month - An integer that represents the month of expiration of the payment card.
        year - An integer that represents the year of expiration of the payment card.
        cvv - An integer that represents the cvv code of the payment card.
        zipcode - An integer that represents the zip code

      • pushDate

        public void pushDate(java.lang.String userName,
                     java.lang.String roomNo,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dateBooked,
                     double cost,
                     java.lang.String dateToDisplay,
                     java.lang.String fullName,
                     java.lang.String checkedInStatus)
        This method pushes the booking made by the user into the invoice data base table.
        Parameters:
        userName - A string that represents the username of the user.
        roomNo - A string that represents the room number of the user.
        dateBooked - An array list that represents the dates the user books.
        cost - A double value that represents the cost of the booking.
        dateToDisplay - A string that represents the date that is selected in the date picker in the UI.
        fullName - A string that represents the full name of the user.
        checkedInStatus - A string that represents whether the guest has been checked in or not.

      • pushDateToRoom

        public java.lang.String pushDateToRoom(java.lang.String room,
                                       java.lang.String userName,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> Datetobebook)
        This method checks for the room category selected are available or not For category it has two differen room available and then check in each rooms database if the rooms are not available for the selected date then it checks the next room If that one is booked then it pops an error message
        Parameters:
        room - for room category
        userName - username for guest
        Datetobebook - date for booking
        Returns:
        room information
